alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Brown; Faribault; Le Sueur; Martin; Nicollet; Sibley; Waseca; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 10:49PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT FARIBAULT...CENTRAL LE SUEUR... EASTERN SIBLEY...EASTERN MARTIN...SOUTHEASTERN BROWN...BLUE EARTH... EASTERN WATONWAN...WESTERN WASECA AND NICOLLET COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM CDT... At 1049 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Ulm to 6 miles southwest of Elmore. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mankato, New Ulm, North Mankato, St. Peter, Le Sueur, Blue Earth, Lake Crystal, Le Center, Eagle Lake, Wells, Madelia, and Gaylord. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 106 and 142. U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 100 and 149. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 1 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.

area.areaDesc: Blue Earth; Brown; Faribault; Le Sueur; Martin; Nicollet; Sibley; Waseca; Watonwan
